top_comments_top.body:
Hello and welcome to r/LifeProTips!

Please help us decide if this post is a good fit for the subreddit by up or downvoting this comment. 

If you think that this is great advice to improve your life, please upvote. If you think this doesn't help you in any way, please downvote. If you don't care, leave it for the others to decide.
But I’m seeing several FB ads for companies who have lost their warehouse leases and are selling $1500 Dell laptops for $79 each!

I started a small business pre-pandemic and advertised on Facebook and Instagram for my Etsy store. It wasn’t a scam and I sold hand made wreaths. I think if it seems too good to be true, ok, but real businesses advertise on social media.
You shouldn't use your debit card for purchases online. Credit cards have much better fraud protection and are more likely to reimburse you.

I just bought something from Facebook ads..... 

.... ads done by a completely reliable known store I like to buy clothes from because the quality is amazing, it's not overpriced, and so on.

Not every ad is a scam (I wouldn't even say the majority is), but you really do have to be careful with *where you buy from*. Reasearch the store first before you order. BUT this goes for any store, not just Facebook ads.

Edit because of typos.

But I’m seeing several FB ads for companies who have lost their warehouse leases and are selling $1500 Dell laptops for $79 each!
Bought some inexpensive puzzles from a FB ad click. They are really cool! But I'll admit my risk was pretty low because I was buying a simple, inexpensive product.

I started a small business pre-pandemic and advertised on Facebook and Instagram for my Etsy store. It wasn’t a scam and I sold hand made wreaths. I think if it seems too good to be true, ok, but real businesses advertise on social media.

As a small farmer this post hurts me. How am i supposed to advertise outside of social media. Go ahead and be wary of social media advertising but dont write me off because i dont sell on amazon.  I just want to sell you some nice handspun yarn and tomatoes im not a scammer i promise.
